metadata.description: Precise chronological data for BMC archive

world.description: President Hindenburg appoints Adolf Hitler as Chancellor, marking the beginning of Nazi control.
Hindenburg names Hitler. Nazi Germany begins.
German parliament building set ablaze. Hitler uses event to suspend civil liberties.

culture.title: King Kong
culture.creator: Merian C. Cooper, Ernest B. Schoedsack
culture.description: Revolutionary special effects film premieres at Radio City Music Hall.

usa.description: 'The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.' New Deal era begins.
Congress gives FDR power to regulate banking. Banks reopen March 13 after 'bank holiday.'

world.event: Enabling Act gives Hitler dictatorial powers
world.description: Reichstag passes act allowing Hitler to enact laws without parliament. Democracy ends in Germany.
Hitler gains dictatorial powers. Democracy ends.
Students burn 25,000 'un-German' books in Berlin's Opera Square. Works by Jewish, pacifist authors destroyed.
25,000 'un-German' books burned in Berlin.

usa.description: FDR signs TVA Act creating federal corporation for regional development through dams and electricity.

world.event: Germany withdraws from League of Nations
world.description: Hitler announces withdrawal from League and Disarmament Conference.
Hitler withdraws from disarmament talks.

usa.description: 21st Amendment ratified, repealing Prohibition after 13 years. Utah is 36th state to ratify.

culture.title: Duck Soup
culture.creator: Leo McCarey, Marx Brothers
culture.description: Marx Brothers' anarchic political satire. Later considered their masterpiece.

world.description: Hitler purges SA leadership. Ernst Röhm and at least 85 others killed. SS becomes dominant.
Following Hindenburg's death, Hitler merges Chancellor and President offices.

culture.title: Anything Goes
culture.creator: Cole Porter
culture.description: Musical opens on Broadway. Ethel Merman stars. 'I Get a Kick Out of You.'

world.description: Hitler announces compulsory military service, violating Treaty of Versailles.
Hitler repudiates Versailles Treaty. Conscription returns.

usa.description: FDR creates WPA by executive order. Will employ 8.5 million including artists and writers.
FDR signs act establishing old-age pensions, unemployment insurance, aid to dependent children.

culture.title: Benny Goodman launches Swing Era
culture.creator: Benny Goodman
culture.description: Palomar Ballroom concert ignites national swing dance craze.

world.description: Laws strip Jews of citizenship and forbid marriage between Jews and non-Jews.
Jews stripped of citizenship. Marriage banned.
Mussolini's forces invade without declaration of war. League condemns but fails to stop.

culture.title: Porgy and Bess
culture.creator: George Gershwin
culture.description: 'Folk opera' premieres. 'Summertime' becomes jazz standard.

culture.title: Cubism and Abstract Art
culture.creator: Alfred H. Barr Jr.
culture.description: MoMA landmark exhibition defines modernist canon.
culture.location: Museum of Modern Art, New York

world.description: German troops march into demilitarized Rhineland, violating Versailles Treaty.
Hitler defies Versailles. Troops enter demilitarized zone.
Nationalist generals led by Franco revolt against Republic. War becomes WWII prelude.
Hitler opens Summer Olympics. Jesse Owens wins 4 gold medals. First televised Olympics.

usa.description: Roosevelt defeats Alf Landon 523-8, largest Electoral College victory since 1820.

world.description: King abdicates to marry American divorcée Wallis Simpson. Brother becomes George VI.
German Luftwaffe bombs Guernica, killing hundreds. Picasso's painting immortalizes atrocity.
German airship catches fire landing at Lakehurst. 36 killed. Ends passenger airship era.

culture.title: The Cradle Will Rock
culture.creator: Marc Blitzstein
culture.description: Federal Theatre banned. Orson Welles stages legendary unauthorized performance.

world.description: Marco Polo Bridge Incident near Beijing escalates into full-scale war.
Marco Polo Bridge Incident. Japan invades China.

culture.title: Guernica exhibited
culture.creator: Pablo Picasso
culture.description: Anti-war masterpiece shown at Spanish Republic pavilion, Paris World's Fair.

culture.title: Benny Goodman at Carnegie Hall
culture.creator: Benny Goodman
culture.description: First jazz concert at Carnegie Hall. Historic integrated performance.

culture.title: Our Town
culture.creator: Thornton Wilder
culture.description: Pulitzer Prize play. Innovative staging without sets.

world.description: German troops march into Austria unopposed. Hitler announces union.
Germany annexes Austria. Union declared.
Britain, France agree to German annexation of Sudetenland. 'Peace for our time.'
Chamberlain declares 'Peace for our time.' Sudetenland ceded.

usa.description: Orson Welles' CBS radio adaptation causes panic as listeners believe Martians invading.

world.description: Nazi mobs attack Jewish homes, businesses, synagogues. 91 killed, 30,000 sent to camps.

culture.title: The Philadelphia Story
culture.creator: Philip Barry
culture.description: Katharine Hepburn stars. Play revives her career.

culture.title: Marian Anderson at Lincoln Memorial
culture.creator: Marian Anderson
culture.description: After DAR ban, contralto performs for 75,000 on Easter Sunday.

usa.description: 'World of Tomorrow' fair with technology exhibits. First public TV demonstration.

culture.title: The Wizard of Oz
culture.creator: Victor Fleming
culture.description: Judy Garland in MGM's Technicolor fantasy. 'Somewhere Over the Rainbow.'

world.description: Non-aggression pact with secret protocols dividing Eastern Europe.
Molotov-Ribbentrop non-aggression pact signed.
1.5 million German troops invade Poland. World War II begins in Europe.
World War II begins in Europe.

world.event: Britain and France declare war on Germany
world.description: After Germany ignores ultimatum, Allies declare war. Second World War begins.
WWII expands. Allies vs Axis.

culture.title: Gone with the Wind
culture.creator: Victor Fleming
culture.description: Civil War epic premieres in Atlanta. Vivien Leigh, Clark Gable.

world.description: Denmark conquered in hours. Norway campaign lasts two months.

world.event: Germany invades Western Europe; Churchill becomes PM
world.description: Attack on Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, France. Churchill replaces Chamberlain.
Blitzkrieg through Low Countries. Churchill becomes PM.
Operation Dynamo evacuates 338,000 Allied soldiers from France over 9 days.
Armistice signed in same railway car where Germany surrendered in 1918.
Armistice signed. Vichy regime begins.
Luftwaffe begins sustained bombing campaign. RAF defends against invasion.

usa.event: Selective Training and Service Act signed
usa.description: First peacetime draft in U.S. history. 16 million men register.
Roosevelt defeats Wendell Willkie, first president to win third term.

culture.title: Duke Ellington at Carnegie Hall
culture.creator: Duke Ellington
culture.description: Premieres 'Black, Brown and Beige' - 45-minute tone poem.

usa.description: Allows U.S. to supply weapons to Britain and Allies. Ends American neutrality.

culture.title: Citizen Kane
culture.creator: Orson Welles
culture.description: Directorial debut revolutionizes cinema with deep focus and non-linear narrative.

world.description: Operation Barbarossa: 3 million troops attack in largest military operation ever.
Germany invades Soviet Union. Largest invasion in history.

usa.description: Japanese attack Pacific Fleet. 2,403 killed, 8 battleships damaged or sunk.

world.description: Japanese attack. 'A date which will live in infamy.'

usa.event: United States declares war on Japan
usa.description: FDR: 'a date which will live in infamy.' War declared with one dissent.

world.event: Germany and Italy declare war on US
world.description: America now fully engaged in both theaters of World War II.

usa.description: 120,000 Japanese Americans, mostly citizens, forced into internment camps.

world.description: U.S. Navy defeats Japan, sinking 4 carriers. Pacific War turning point.
Marines land in first major Allied offensive. Six-month battle follows.

culture.title: Art of This Century gallery opens
culture.creator: Peggy Guggenheim
culture.description: Frederick Kiesler-designed space showcases Surrealism and emerging Abstract Expressionists.

world.event: Operation Torch: Allied invasion of North Africa
world.description: Anglo-American forces land in Morocco and Algeria. First major US ground operation.
Allied invasion of North Africa.

culture.title: Casablanca
culture.creator: Michael Curtiz
culture.description: Bogart and Bergman in wartime romance. 'Here's looking at you, kid.'

world.description: 6th Army surrenders after brutal urban combat. 91,000 captured. Major turning point.
German 6th Army destroyed. War's turning point.

culture.title: Oklahoma!
culture.creator: Rodgers and Hammerstein
culture.description: Revolutionary musical integrates song, dance, story. 2,212 performances.

world.description: Operation Husky: 160,000 troops land. Mussolini falls two weeks later.
Armistice signed. Germany immediately occupies much of Italy.
Operation Overlord: 156,000 troops land on five beaches. Largest amphibious invasion ever.
Allied invasion of Normandy. 'Operation Overlord.'

usa.description: Servicemen's Readjustment Act provides education, housing benefits to veterans.

world.description: Stauffenberg's bomb fails. Thousands executed in reprisals.
French and American forces liberate Paris after 4 years. De Gaulle leads parade.
French and American forces free capital.
Germany's last major offensive. 200,000 troops attack through Ardennes.
German counter-offensive. Last major Nazi attack.

culture.title: The Glass Menagerie
culture.creator: Tennessee Williams
culture.description: 'Memory play' premieres. Laurette Taylor stars.

world.description: FDR, Churchill, Stalin plan post-war Europe. UN, division of Germany agreed.
Marines invade. 36-day battle. Iconic flag-raising on Mount Suribachi.

usa.description: FDR dies of cerebral hemorrhage. Truman sworn in as 33rd President.

culture.title: Carousel
culture.creator: Rodgers and Hammerstein
culture.description: Dark musical. 'You'll Never Walk Alone' becomes anthem.

world.description: Hitler kills himself in bunker as Soviets close in. Eva Braun dies with him.
Germany signs unconditional surrender. Victory in Europe celebrated.
Germany surrenders. Victory in Europe.

usa.description: Trinity test. Oppenheimer: 'I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.'

world.description: 'Enola Gay' drops uranium bomb. 80,000 killed instantly; 140,000 by year's end.
'Little Boy' kills 80,000 instantly.
Second bomb destroys Nagasaki. 40,000 killed. Japan begins surrender talks.
'Fat Man' kills 40,000. Japan near surrender.
Emperor Hirohito announces surrender. World War II ends after six years.
V-J Day. World War II ends.
International tribunal tries 24 Nazi war criminals. Establishes legal precedents.
'An iron curtain has descended across the Continent.' Cold War rhetoric begins.
Churchill coins term at Westminster College.

culture.title: Annie Get Your Gun
culture.creator: Irving Berlin
culture.description: Ethel Merman as Annie Oakley. 'There's No Business Like Show Business.'

usa.description: Pledges support for countries resisting communism. $400M for Greece and Turkey.

world.description: US pledges to contain communism.

usa.event: Jackie Robinson breaks baseball color barrier
usa.description: First Black player in MLB since 1880s debuts for Brooklyn Dodgers.
Massive European recovery aid program proposed. $13 billion provided 1948-1952.

world.description: European Recovery Program proposed at Harvard.

culture.title: A Streetcar Named Desire
culture.creator: Tennessee Williams
culture.description: Brando as Stanley Kowalski. 'I have always depended on the kindness of strangers.'

world.description: Ben-Gurion declares independence. U.S. recognizes immediately. Arab-Israeli War begins.
David Ben-Gurion proclaims Jewish state.

culture.title: LP records introduced
culture.creator: Columbia Records
culture.description: 33 1/3 RPM unveiled at Waldorf Astoria. 10" and 12" formats revolutionize music.

world.description: Soviets block ground access. Allies begin airlift to supply 2.5 million residents.

culture.title: Death of a Salesman
culture.creator: Arthur Miller
culture.description: Pulitzer Prize. Cobb as Willy Loman. 'Attention must be paid.'

world.description: Twelve nations sign North Atlantic Treaty for collective defense.
Mao declares Communist victory. Nationalists flee to Taiwan.
North Korea invades South. UN intervenes. Cold War turns hot.

culture.title: John Cage's 4'33"
culture.creator: John Cage
culture.description: David Tudor premieres silent composition. Audience sounds become the music.

world.description: Armistice ends fighting. Korea remains divided. 36,000 Americans died.

usa.description: Supreme Court: school segregation unconstitutional. 'Separate is inherently unequal.'
Refuses to give up bus seat. Sparks Montgomery Bus Boycott led by MLK Jr.

culture.title: My Fair Lady
culture.creator: Lerner and Loewe
culture.description: Rex Harrison, Julie Andrews. Record 2,717 performances.

usa.description: Governor uses Guard to block Black students. Eisenhower sends federal troops.

culture.title: West Side Story
culture.creator: Bernstein, Sondheim
culture.description: Modern Romeo and Juliet. Jerome Robbins choreography.

world.description: First artificial satellite. Space race begins. Americans shocked.
Chinese Communists flee Nationalists. Mao emerges.
Hitler and Mussolini alliance announced.
Japanese troops kill 200,000+ civilians.
Hitler breaks Munich Agreement.
338,000 Allied troops rescued.
German troops enter French capital.
German bombing of London starts.
Nazi influence expands in Balkans.
Balkan campaign. Athens falls April 27.
900-day siege. 1 million civilians die.
Final Solution planned. Holocaust systematized.
Bloodiest battle in history. 2 million casualties.
FDR, Churchill, Stalin meet. Plan D-Day.
UN Charter ratified. 51 founding members.
US grants independence after 48 years.
British India partitioned. Massive migration.
Jewish and Arab states planned.
Hindu extremist kills Mahatma Gandhi.
Soviets install communist government.
Federal Republic of Germany founded.
USSR ends US nuclear monopoly.
300,000 Chinese troops cross Yalu River.
General relieved of Korean command.
Japan peace treaty signed. Occupation ends.

world.event: Bobby Thomson's 'Shot Heard Round the World'
world.description: Giants win pennant. Historic baseball moment.
Conservatives win. Labour defeated.
Elizabeth II becomes Queen.
Third nuclear power after US, USSR.
'Ivy Mike' at Eniwetok. 1000x Hiroshima.
Soviet dictator dead at 74. Power struggle begins.
First televised coronation. 27 million watch.
Workers revolt. Soviet tanks crush protest.
French defeated in Vietnam. Colonial era ends.
Vietnam divided at 17th parallel.
Physicist dies at 76 in Princeton.
Soviet military alliance responds to NATO.
First theme park in Anaheim.
Secret speech reveals Stalin's crimes.
Anti-Soviet uprising in Budapest.
Israel, Britain, France attack Egypt.
European Economic Community founded.
First animal in orbit. Dog dies in space.
